Cover Corp Q1 2025: Revenue Growth Insights
item.author: Thomas Toblu
item.content:encoded: Figure — Revenue trend (FY totals and latest Q1).Cover’s Q1 (three months ended June 30, 2025) is a clearest-possible example of a business shifting from product-market proof into active scale mode. The quarter delivered a large top-line jump driven by one particularly successful product line, while the company also pushed hard on infrastructure, technology and overseas expansion. That combination produced solid absolute profits but compressed margins compared with the company’s best historical quarters.Below is a full read of the quarter: the numbers, what caused them, how Cover is allocating capital, the tensions and risks this creates, and the structural strengths that make this a meaningful pivot rather than a one-off spike.Cash & Cash Equivalents (end Q1)(Values and percent changes from Cover Corp Q1 presentation.)Where the growth came fromThe dominant story for the quarter is merchandising — specifically, the launch and rapid scale of the hololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME (TCG). Merchandising accounted for roughly of Q1 revenue (about ¥5.84B of ¥9.63B). The TCG moved Cover from a diversified-revenue mix into a quarter where a single product family was the largest contributor.Figure — Q1 revenue mix: merchandising was roughly 60% of sales this quarter.Why the TCG matters: it combines recognizable IP, repeat purchase cycles (new sets, booster releases), event-driven demand (tournaments and league play) and collectible economics. Those characteristics make it high-leverage for an IP-first company: strong unit economics on physical product, recurring drop cycles, and community-driven engagement that feeds back into virtual events and content.That concentration is important — it produced the big topline move, but it also creates a single-point dependency for quarterly performance.Profits, margins and the investment trade-offCover delivered higher absolute profits (operating profit ¥972M, net profit ¥693M), but margins show the impact of active reinvestment.Figure — Gross, operating and net margins for the quarter (rounded).: strong. The merchandising-heavy mix, where merchandise typically carries healthier gross margins than pure streaming revenue, lifted gross profitability.: positive but compressed relative to periods without heavy upfront investment. The company reports increasing R&D, logistics consolidation and overseas setup costs that absorb a portion of the gross uplift.: likewise positive but indicates a significant share of revenue is consumed by the non-operating items and tax/interest compared with gross profit.Put simply: revenue growth translated into higher gross profit, but Cover deliberately reallocated a chunk of that cash into investments intended to expand future capacity and quality — which lowered the percent of revenue that flowed through to operating profit this quarter.Where Cover is spending — the “build” phaseCover describes its current actions as foundational: spending now for capabilities that should help scale the business and diversify revenue later. The main categories of investment called out in the quarter:Expressive technology & R&D — more advanced 3D/live concert tooling, motion capture workflows, and production technology that enable richer, more interactive shows and collaboration with external partners.Logistics and supply chain — a consolidated logistics center began full operation on , intended to shorten delivery times and reduce per-order handling costs as volumes grow.Overseas expansion & local channels — building localized EC presence and licensing relationships in North America and other regions to reduce cross-border friction and capture more local demand.Content and event production capacity — more concerts, larger productions, and supplemental studio/staff investment to raise product quality and live-event scale.Management also presented a medium-term investment plan that contemplates roughly of cumulative growth investments (including M&A) through FY2030, paired with an ambition to reach ~¥100 billion in revenue and ¥25 billion in operating profit by that horizon. Those numbers frame the current investments as strategic and multi-year rather than simply tactical.Balance sheet — runway exists, for nowCover finished Q1 with about in cash and equivalents. The company is profitable in absolute terms and holds a meaningful cash cushion. That balance sheet provides runway to fund the medium-term build-out and to absorb some execution hiccups — but it does not eliminate the need for measured returns on the substantial planned investments.Because the company intends large, multi-year capital and M&A commitments, the health of the balance sheet will depend on the pace at which investment converts into recurring revenue and margin expansion.Risks and friction points made explicit in the reportSeveral concrete risks are visible in the Q1 materials:Concentration risk (TCG dependency): merchandising’s outsized contribution (nearly +100% YoY growth) is heavily tied to the TCG. If demand softens, or if competitors or product fatigue reduce momentum, merchandising could normalize sharply.Trade policy and tariffs: management noted a tariff-driven hit to North American e-commerce that temporarily cut monthly sales from that region to roughly half prior-year levels at one stage. International trade policy is an external variable that affected EC performance and pushes the company to localize sales channels.Rising fixed costs and execution risk: new logistics, studios, staff and technology create a higher fixed cost base. If revenue growth doesn’t keep pace or new products take longer to mature, margins could be pressured. retirements reduced membership/streaming revenue in the quarter. A business rooted in performers will always carry talent risk — retirements, image issues, or turnover can materially affect engagement and related revenue.These are not hypothetical risks; they are the issues the company called out and positioned as active items to manage.Strengths and structural positivesAlongside these risks there are structural positives worth noting:Proven product-market fit for a physical IP product. The TCG demonstrated tangible ability to convert virtual talent and fandom into a mainstream hobby product, with tournament and community play amplifying demand.Licensing & partner momentum. The company is expanding licensing relationships and working to monetize IP across platforms and territories — a natural path for an IP-first company that can linearize its fanbase into multiple product categories.Operational upgrades that compound. The logistics center and supply-chain consolidation can reduce marginal shipping costs and delivery headaches as volume increases; technology investments (Holoearth and expressive tech) can yield differentiated experiences that are harder to replicate.Positive absolute profitability and cash buffers. Cover is not burning cash this quarter; it is generating operating profit while building. That gives management flexibility to absorb execution variance and pursue strategic expansion.Looking forward — what the next few quarters will revealThis quarter is the start of a new phase: the charts and numbers show a business that converted IP into a high-volume merchandising product and then immediately reinvested that success into infrastructure and product expansion. The next few quarters will be the test:Is merchandising strength repeatable beyond the immediate launch windows of the TCG?Does localization and supply-chain work blunt the tariff impacts and restore more stable overseas growth?Will the investment program start to generate margin expansion, or will the fixed-cost base outpace revenue increases?Answers to those questions will determine whether Q1 is the opening chapter of durable scale or a high-water mark that requires careful management to sustain.Cover’s Q1 is a mixture of a clear success and deliberate risk-taking. The company turned a major IP product into a dominant, high-margin revenue source for the quarter and used that momentum to finance infrastructure and capability-building. That approach has solid rationale: merchandising and events coupled with improved logistics and expressive tech can turn transient product spikes into sustainable revenue platforms. But it also creates execution dependencies — concentration around a single product line, external policy exposures, and a heavier fixed-cost base.Numbers this quarter are real and meaningful: strong revenue growth, improved gross profit, positive operating profit and a healthy cash position. The key question is whether the investments now under way will diversify and stabilize revenue while improving long-term margins — or whether the company will need to adjust if merchandising cools and the new fixed costs remain high. The Q1 slides make both the upside and the risks explicit; the next few quarterly reports will tell which direction the company’s execution takes.Cover Corp FY2026/3 Q1 presentation (financial results for the three months ended June 30, 2025) — numbers and program descriptions are taken from the company’s Q1 materials. embedded charts created from the Q1 figures (revenue trend, Q1 revenue mix, margin breakdown; headline table shows key metrics).

An Interview with Shishiro Botan & Project Leader – The Passion and Creative Collaboration Behind Shishiro Hai
item.author: cover_hirata
item.content:encoded: There are around 90 talents affiliated with hololive production*. As a business, we naturally need to focus on driving revenue – but our resources aren’t unlimited. And from the talent side, they each have projects they want to pursue too, while also managing their regular streams, preparing for anniversary events, and planning other special content. So they’re constantly juggling a lot. Back in 2023, when Shishiro Hai was just getting off the ground, one of the biggest challenges was figuring out how the company could expand its support among the resources limitations that exist on both the company and talent sides.So I approached my manager with a proposal: “Maybe we can generate revenue in ways that go beyond the traditional model if we can turn the things our talents genuinely want to do into business opportunities.” That way the talents get to pursue what they’re passionate about, and the company can allocate resources accordingly if it’s a viable revenue stream. It’s a win-win for everyone. Shishiro Hai was a perfect example of this: it became a way to bring Shishiro Botan’s passion to life, while also creating opportunities for sponsorship and monetization.Fortunately, I happened to be in the sales department at that time, which allowed me to casually sound out a few trusted companies and get an early read on their interest. That helped me sketch out a rough budget plan and move forward with an internal proposal, which was officially approved on the condition that it would be monetized properly from the very first installment. In her interview, Shishiro Botan mentioned that “there wasn’t a lot of movement” after our initial discussions but the truth is that this was the time when I was working behind the scenes to try and get everyone on board! lol.

item.title: Relive the Magic of hololive night 2025!
item.author: narita
item.content:encoded: On July 5, 2025, the much-anticipated second collaboration between hololive production and the Los Angeles Dodgers took place in Los Angeles, California at the Dodger Stadium!Starring Ninomae Ina’nis, IRyS, and Koseki Bijou from hololive English, the event was full of exciting activities that ran in tandem with the game — which included a live sing-a-long of “Take Me Out to the Ball Game” during the 7th inning stretch, unique hype videos, and a special first pitch by YAGOO himself!Aside from in-game features, attendees were also able to enjoy pre- and post-game activities, such as an unprecedented world-first VTuber livestream to and from Dodger Stadium. It was a night to remember for both fans of hololive and the L.A. Dodgers!The game started with YAGOO taking to the field to throw the first pitch. Mascot characters Subaru Duck and UDIN also made an appearance on the field, watching over YAGOO as he threw the ceremonial first pitch.Soon after, Ninomae Ina’nis, IRyS, and Koseki Bijou greeted hololive production and Dodgers fans alike with the iconic phrase said before every Dodger game – “It’s time for Dodger baseball!” And with that, the game between the Los Angeles Dodgers and the Houston Astros began!As the match continued, exclusive hype videos from the three talents were broadcast to the stadium, encouraging fans to show their support for the Dodgers. At the 7th inning stretch, all three talents led the crowd in a passionate performance of the classic baseball anthem “Take Me Out to the Ball Game”. The passion was certainly felt, as the crowd’s cheers echoed throughout the stadium at the encouragement of Ninomae Ina’nis, IRyS, and Koseki Bijou.But outside of the “in-game” entertainment, guests were able to indulge in a range of activities for a full ‘hololive’ experience. Attendees received special hololive night trading cards upon entry, this time featuring Ninomae Ina’nis, IRyS, and Koseki Bijou dressed for the occasion in their very own Los Angeles Dodgers uniforms. The line for attendees to get their hands on these exclusive trading cards stretched well into the parking lot, showing just how much enthusiasm there was for the return of this collaboration.Located around the stadium were various photo spots for attendees to take pictures with the featured talents in the form of life-sized cutouts with themed backgrounds. Subaru Duck and UDIN also made a special appearance for photos. Fans in their commemorative jerseys, cosplays, and casual wear stood in line to take pictures with their favorite talent, memorializing the moment in the form of a photograph.There was no shortage of special merchandise to purchase! Commemorative towels, lanyards, stickers, T-Shirts, can cooler, and acrylic stands themed after the event were available to purchase at the stadium. The collaboration merchandise features all three featured talents in Los Angeles Dodgers signature blue and white branding, capturing the spirit of the team with hololive production talents together. And just like the line for the trading cards, the merchandise booths were packed with eager fans looking to get their hands on these goods.For those that purchased popcorn or soda (or a beer) to enjoy at the game, special commemorative cups and popcorn buckets were distributed to attendees. Each of these items featured unique packaging with illustrations of Ninomae Ina’nis, IRyS, and Koseki Bijou in their uniforms.To wrap up the collaboration event, a special Post-Game Special Program was held on the field. As fans stepped onto the field, Ninomae Ina’nis, IRyS, and Koseki Bijou appeared on the big screen, and the world’s first ever VTuber live stream to and from Dodger Stadium began! Fans all around the world were able to join in the Post-Game Special Program in real time alongside the audience at Dodger Stadium!The experience included interactive segments such as a “Staring Contest”, where talents competed with fans on the field in a game of endurance, and “WHO’s Got the MOVES?!” dance challenge where attendees danced along to the choruses of beloved hololive production songs.But that’s not all! Throughout the night, surprise videos messages from hololive English -Myth-, hololive English -Promise-, hololive English -Advent-, and hololive English -Justice- kept the energy high with their cheer.Towards the end of the event, highlight videos from previous hololive English concerts and concert events were shown, leading up to performances of songs like “Connect the World,” “Breaking Dimensions,” and “Our Bright Parade”. The energy among the fans reached its peak as the event drew to a powerful and unforgettable climax.The night ended in excitement, with fans of both the Los Angeles Dodgers and hololive experiencing the best of both worlds.Date: July 5th, 2025 4:15 PM (PDT) Venue: Dodger Stadium (Los Angeles, CA) Ninomae Ina’nis / IRyS / Koseki Bijou #hololiveDodgers

I’ve never felt more alive! Even though I’m a zombie, hehe Me but with big boobs. I’m not that loud anymore, I speak English most of the time, and I’m not always horny I promise 🥹🥹 If I don’t work then I can’t pay bills, as simple as that uwu I usually just stop when it starts straining me~ Knowing when your streaming limit is very important! Better to rest for a day than be burnt out for a whole month 👍✨️ I feel like if I auditioned now then I wouldn’t be able to make it KSKSKSKKSK the level of entertainment needed to pass auditions is CRAZY (no pun intended) and I’ve always felt lucky that I managed to get in when I had little very little experience 👀 As for ambassadors hmmmmm I think we’ll just have to wait and see~!! I’ve said this a lot on stream and I won’t ever stop recommending Yogyakarta! It’s a province with more Indonesian cultures and is budget-friendly, even for Indonesians! ✨️ There’s also Lembang, it’s high in the mountains and it has beautiful scenery and lots of tourist spots! It’s definitely a local go-to 🌄✨️ Someone who’s professional but also friendly! Having too much of one of these qualities makes it a bit hard for me to lead/follow, so definitely someone that has a good balance in between!👍 Blue Prince! I’ve been wanting to play it but I keep forgetting 😩 My family was financially in the gutters and I had to share a meal with 4 of my family members… I couldn’t do the things that I wanted because there was no money for it, and I had a student loan with my uncle. The only thing I did was study and survive. Being in hololive changed my whole life, and my family’s too. I get to do the things I want and get an income out of it- I wouldn’t trade it for anything in the world 🫶💞 As a fan-turned-idol, I like how I’m able to see what both worlds look like- I love how I can nerd out with fans and also work towards the same goals with my beloved hololivers 🫶💖 I visioned myself just playing games, now I’m performing for world tour 👁👄👁 I honestly don’t know what the future holds~ Schedules and staying relevant is hard- You can’t come up with banger tweets everyday and there’s so much more to vtubing than just streaming so it gets hard 😭😭 This is pretty much impossible, but I kinda want to see hololive making its own anime series 👀 Wanting to go to hololive pop-up stores/collab cafes I’ve always wanted to be a voice actor, but I couldn’t be one so VTuber is kinda my next best thing 👉👈 I’m optimistic that it’ll only grow bigger from now! hololive has also been cooking so many innovations behind the screen, so I’m confident to say that maybe we’ll be as well-known as Hatsune Miku! 🔥🔥 There’s a solo concert that I really want to do, but I think that’s still a long way for me! I mostly remember the down parts, there was actually a time where I would cry on membership streams for a whole year every week lol (I’m all fine now tho! :DDD) And I think my peak is actually right now?! I’ve beem provided so many great opportunities, holoplus include 🥹🫶💞 (thanks holoplus team 🫰) As for nendoroids and figmas, we’ll just have to be patient! It takes two to tango and hololive is doing their best to get us the nendos! ✨️✨️ Someone who makes other people happy by doing what they love 💖 1. holoplus is a space where you could oshikatsu TO THE MAX with fan focused features and the latest oshi news! 2. I hope more people will use holoplus more because it’s honestly so convenient! Also I hope that the features that are being cooked gets released soon uashdvaudva the team is working sooo harddd❤️‍❤️‍ AMOGUS The hololive song that I listen to the most has to be “A Horny Money World”!! I’ve been listening to it ever since Marine-senpai’s live 🔥🔥 It’s still my proudest piece yet! My hololive Medllie (Medley + Ollie)✨️✨️ It’s my gratitude for hololive fans and the hololive talents that kept on inspiring me 💞💞 Mau jadi ambassador UNIQLO, sama-sama merah uwu Kanata-senpai’s “Bessekai” is my ultimate favorite, it’s so beautiful and delicate, the lyrics are relatable for me and I find it poetic and beautiful 💙 It was a recent stream, but I really like the Valentine’s stream I did this 2025! The one with the maid competition! It was so fun to plan something so simple yet so fun! It doesn’t have the most views, but I felt nothing but joy for that one stream~ Okay IMAGINE THIS: ✨️A BACKSCRATCHER IN THE FORM OF OLLIE’S ARM✨️ hehe~ My zomily gave me this idea and I’d LOVE for this to happen 🥹🥹💞 *winkwonkmanagementpleaseletthisbeathing Reine is the “putri merak yang tertiup angin”, meaning she’s a peafowl princess blown from the wind, so I think it’d be SICK to make a fan (literal fan) merch for her! 🌬💨🍃 Everyone’s faces and reactions, of course! Seeing you guys are what I’m most excited about 🫰💞💞 (setidaknya bisa lihat muka) IS THAT EVEN A QUESTION⁉️⁉️💖💞❣️🌷🔥✨️🎉💃 Being a vtuber is COSTLY; even as a corp Vtuber, I put out so much of my savings for projects like 3D Lives, original songs, collab projects, etc! So make sure you’re doing this because you like Vtubing. Please don’t pressure yourself to make covers or big projects if you’re not emotionally, mentally, or financially prepared. You don’t need to rush, things takes time, so be kind to yourself and your wallet. ✨️THEIR WITTINESS✨️ When Vtubers know the perfect things to say on the perfect time, that’s the ideal Vtuber~ A few examples are Laplus and Fubuki-senpai! I’ll be frank, the bar is VEEEEERYYYY high right now… The only tip that I can give you is if you have a talent/personality that hololive doesn’t have yet! Let’s say for example uh… An opera singer? My first ever work from holoplus was to give them ideas and suggestions on what the talents/fans would maybe like to see in holoplus! This QnA is actually my second work as the ambassador, and we’ll have plenty of fun things prepared in the future! There’s so many questions asking what I’m most excited for and I can’t actually tell you guys cause it’s going to be a surprise 👀 Things aren’t always that complicated, slow down and take your time processing everything uwu (I was very impatient back then) This is a tough one 🤔 I’ve had my dream collab with Indomie/PopMie, so I never really thought about it! But if I had to shoot for the sky… CROCS!! I love wearing Crocs!! :DDD Dulu Ollie dipaksa harus tinggalin mimpi Ollie hanya karena nggak mampu… Pas denger audisi Vtuber, bagi Ollie itu bagaikan kesempatan terakhir Ollie untuk wujudin mimpi- jadi Ollie kejar terus sampe dapet pokoknya!!! I feel like we can determine the vector by considering “does this degrade my oshi” and “will this offend anyone else than my oshi”! It might be a hardline to read especially if you’re trying to do an edgy joke, so I usually rewrite my jokes so that it’s a lot more seiso! Different types of music inspires me in different ways! As for lately, I’ve been inspired by cute-kawaii pop songs! 🫶🌷🍓✨️ Lucu aja AOWKOWKWOWKWOK Internet connections/obs dying 🥲 I also hate it when I get one-guyed, I hate myself whenever I fall for it 😭😭 I dream of a collab with JaidenAnimations (now that she’s also a vtuber!), maybe a Pokémon collab?? uuuuuuu that’d be great 🥹🥹 Cyndaquil LOVE 🫶🔥 I don’t know if other countries have this or not, but we have QRIS where we pay everything with a QR code 📲 And I think we use QR codes for a lot of stuffs! Social media, restaurant menus, transactions, etc! Pretty handy! OH and we also rent powerbanks in malls so that’s a win too~ I understand 😭😭 Mostly because textbook Indonesian and daily Indonesian are completely different 😭😭 My tips is to have conversations or listen to a lot of Indonesian conversation! SHOCK THERAPHY BABY 🔥🔥 That’s how I forced myself to speak Japanese when I didn’t know the language! I’m flattered omg??? 😭😭 Thank you, I’m glad you see me as a nice person 🥹🥹 It’s weird giving out advice for kindness, but I usually treat people the way I want them to treat me- so because I’m a needy girl then I try to provide as much care to the people around me! If I were having a bad day, I for sure would love to have someone to cheer me up 🫶 I think you’re talking about kanjis, and the advice that I got from my JP senpais is: don’t sweat the kanjis! JP peeps have trouble with kanjis too wwwwwww But definitely start slow, if you haven’t had your hiragana down then try writing two full pages of 1 letter every single day! That’s how I learned Japanese, and even Arabic! It’s tedious, but this method makes hiragana/katakana stick to me faster! Honestly, it’ll be easier to learn Japanese once you have the basics down! Start by learning hiragana, and if you’re feeling it, you can try katakana too! After you learn the alphabets, learn how to use Japanese particles like を, に, で, の, は, が etc! I suggest studying from Kirakira nihongo! It’s very easy to follow! After that, just practice your Japanese with a friend or watch JP media without relying on subs! That’s how I learned them! :DDD Pertanyaannya bikin greget ya- hmm… Boneka Miteiru Jumbo dari Shirakami Fubuki, karena bisa jadi bantal buat ditidurin- WATCHING VTUBERS FOR 7 YEARS⁉️⁉️ YOU’RE 14⁉️⁉️⁉️🤯🤯 WOW– UM– I really hope you’ve been watching the family-friendly talents kEKW You’ve been watching hololive longer than I have, so I think you should have a proper idea of what hololive looks for in a talent! A lot of factors play into the audition, but what matters is how determined you are in becoming one of us!! ✨️ ONLY audition when you’ve reached age requirement tho, okay? That’s not the only thing we see 👁👁 I DID………. But then I realized how expensive that would be so I scratched the idea hehe Pssst don’t tell them but ummm… It’s Kiara-senpai and FUWAMOCO 👉👈💖 amiiiiiiiiin 🙏 Rather than having all of the MMDs public, I think it’s best to do whatever makes the talents happy! Whether they want their MMDs public, or if they want it private 🫶❣️ Like, comment, follow, subscribe~ (no like for real dO IT NOW) Laplus, I’ve noticed that she’s just so unapologetically her around everyone- She brought a toy horse back stage during holofes for good luck- Definitely Ina! And always will be Ina! WAH Elizabeth because she is SUCH a gentlewoman UGHHH💖💖💞💞 I’m sorry Shiori but I stan BloodRaven 💄🎼🫶💖 I’ve carried Kobo plenty of times so yeah! Roboco, Akirose, Subaru (Choco-sensei is curved but something about Subaru-senpai’s hips got me 😳😳), Marine, Watame I guess?? (gen 4 only has cute members now), Botan, Lui, Ririka, Chihaya, Moona, Reine, Zeta, Kiara, Kronii, Nerissa, Raora- phewww those are my opinions! It was the holoplus team that reached out to me first and offered me this amazing opportunity! Having given this honorable role, I aspire to invite the community towards a more OSHIKATSU community space and make connections between fans and talents! (I’ll drink water now hehe thank you) holoplus is honestly an app that I’ve been dreaming of existing (and I’m not saying this because I’m the ambassador hehe) Our focus gets scattered when using other social medias because of outside interest and recommended posts, while in holoplus, we get to entirely invest our focus to hololive! I don’t have to open the hololive schedule website to check for streams, I could do it in holoplus! If I want to know the latest news like new outfits or even 3D Lives, holoplus got me covered! It’s honestly so convenient, I’m just waiting for my own official holoplus account so that I could just start posting here adsfgfhjisheb Ollie ingin lebih banyak berinteraksi dengan kalian para fans! Waktu jadi ambassador holomeet, Ollie nggak terlalu banyak bekerja- jadi kali ini Ollie pengen lebih aktif lagi! I’ve given all my ideas to the holoplus team already and a few of them they are already working on so I’ll let this be a surprise for now~ YES To drag all of you and use this superior app MWAHAHHAHAHAH WHY WOULD I THINK TWICE ABOUT BECOMING THE AMBASSADOR OF THE HOLOLIVE OSHIKATSU SOCIAL MEDIA??? IT WAS AN IMMEDIATE YESSSS Um… Blend in… Yeah… Pros, you’re already dead so nothing kills you and you can pop your head whenever! 🧟‍♀️✨️ Cons, body parts are basically rotting so it’s prone to illnesses and injuries 💦 CYBOOOOORGGG YEAHHHH LASER EYESSSSSSS 🔥🔥🔥 1000 BAJILLION DOLLARS🤑🤑 I’ve always loved Elephants!🐘💖 “Shampoo… *screams at the sight of soap*” Hard question because every vocaloid song is so good- But the first song that popped in my head was “Neko Neko☆Super Fever Night” because it’s just so hype and I LOVE listening to the niconico utaites singing it together 🐱🐾 Favorite composer is DECO*27! He was the one who made my entire childhood with all his songs, so when I sang the chorus for ZOMBIE it was like a dream come true!!🥰🥰 INAZUMA ELEVEN ⚽️⚡️ Does Raimon Eleven from Inazuma Eleven count- I was actually shocked that everybody was so supportive! I was ready for people to ramble at me about diet plans and work-out tips- but everybody embraced the chubby belly?!?!?😳😳 Boring answer: I like spending time with friends and family; Other answer: Stalk fan’s twitter accounts I love comfy and long dresses; I’ve been looking into modern hanfus and traditional qipaos lately! Tshirts at home- Just Tshirts uwu Golf is something that I’ve been dying on trying! You just hit a ball and walk with your friends across the field- Aquariums for sure! It’s basically just a chicken skewer, so I grade them the same level as Satay!🍢 I like anything doughy! Like cake batter ice cream! No, I’m Indonesian and cheese is so expensive owo YASSSS LITERALLY PLEASE INVITE ME TO ANY HAWAII CONVENTIONS I WOULD LOVE TO GO 😭😭 Swiss has been in my bucket list for sooo longg A glass cabinet!
